sources.title: Bloody Pit of Horror (1965)
sources.description: Bloody Pit of Horror is a 1965 Italian Gothic horror film directed by Massimo Pupillo . Featuring a blend of macabre themes and campy elements, it has garnered attention over the years for its unusual narrative and stylistic choices.The film follows a group of models who enter an abandoned castle for a photo shoot under the direction of a writer and his team. Unbeknownst to them, the castle's owner, Travis Anderson (played by Mickey Hargitay ), has donned the persona of the Crimson Executioner , a character bent on torturing and killing the group using various gruesome methods inspired by historical torture devices.

sources.title: Bloody. Pit.of. Horror/Il Boia Scarlatto
sources.description: This  edition  of "Bloody Pit of Horror" omits the message from the Marquis de Sade, and includes Italian-langage credits. All dialogue is dubbed English, and runtime is about 87 minutes. This is a straight print -- no superimposed images, no animated intros.

metadata.Plot: Writer Rick and his publisher Daniel Parks finally find the ideal location in Italy to shoot some photographs for Rick's Horror photo-novel when they come across an ideal spot. The seemingly deserted castle looks perfect from the outside, so Rick and Daniel, accompanied by his secretary Edith, their photographer Dermott, and his five young models decide to break in. They soon find the castle is actually occupied by former actor, Travis Anderson, who initially is annoyed with these visitors until he recognises Edith, his ex-fiancèe amongst them. He decides to give them permission to use his castle, but warns them that the dungeons are off limits. Will they heed his warning?
metadata.Actors: Mickey Hargitay, Walter Brandi, Luisa Baratto
